name: Elnode
body:
# Elnode - event driven web development in Emacs Lisp Elnode let's you write event driven code for handling HTTP requests. You can make web servers, handle files, do AJAX or write a chat app. ## Hello World with Elnode ```` (defun my-elnode-hello-world-handler (httpcon) (elnode-http-start httpcon 200 '("Content-Type" . "text/html")) (elnode-http-return httpcon "

Hello World

")) (elnode-start 'my-elnode-hello-world-handler :port 8028 :host "localhost") ```` ## Getting Elnode Download Elnode from [marmalade](http://marmalade-repo.org/packages/elnode) using Emacs package install: ```` M-x package-install elnode ```` ## Bugs Please report all bugs here, on github. New releases are made frequently so please check for new versions before reporting. ## Author Elnode is maintained by Nic Ferrier.
tagline: event driven web development in EmacsLisp
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
